result.execSummary:
The defendant Edward L. Stoetzel was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (2nd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).
  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay fine totaling $1,442.00.  Pay within 60 days.
Pay blood draw fee of $26.45.  Pay within 60 days.

Commence within 60 days. 
May serve half on electronic monitor. 
Huber granted.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

miscConds.notes:
Pay costs including the DNA surcharge. 
If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.

Do not possess illegal controlled substances.
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription by a treating physician.
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia.
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.

Comply with other recommendations as recommended by the agent.
Submit DNA sample, if not already done so. 
If agent recommends, can early discharge defendant from probation.
Obtain an AODA & comply with treatment recommendations and any further treatment that counselor feels is appropriate.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Edward L. Stoetzel

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Edward L. Stoetzel
Current: 2183 Strongs Avenue, Stevens Point, WI 54481 United States  (Effective: 11-02-2015)
Prior: 2183 Strongs Avenue, Stevens Point, WI 54481 United States

ADDRESS INFO for Edward L. Stoetzel
Current: 2183 Strongs Avenue, Stevens Point, WI 54481 United States  (Effective: 11-02-2015)
Prior: 9214 Spring Creek Road, Amherst, WI 54406

Defendant Edward L. Stoetzel in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

2:59 PM Court calls case.
Court states appearances.

Matter is set for a plea and sentence today.

There is a plea agreement.
Defendant will plead to Count 1.
Defendant will plead to Count 2.

State has no objection to early discharge from probation.
Atty Drengler concurs.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.

Defendant enters a plea of: Count 1: NO CONTEST
Defendant enters a plea of: Count 2: NO CONTEST

Court questions Defendant regarding pleas.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney Drengler for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charges.

Atty Drengler stipulates that this is a second offense for OWI.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.
Court finds the defendant guilty to Count 1 and Count 2.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

Atty Knaapen makes sentencing arguments to the Court, addresses Defendant's background.
Atty Drengler makes sentencing arguments to the Court, agrees with recommendation as stated by the State.

Court has a number of factors to consider to determine sentencing.

BY THE COURT:
Count 1:
Jail sentence for 10 Days
Commence within 60 days
May serve half on electronic monitor
Huber granted
Pay a fine of $1,442.00 (which includes DNA surcharge)
60 days to pay the costs and fine
Pay blood draw fee of $26.45
DL Revoked for 13 Months
IID for 13 Months on vehicles owned and titled to Defendant, effective TODAY

Count 2:
Jail sentence for 9 Months, Imposed and Stayed
Probation for a period of 24 Months
Conditions:
Obtain an AODA and comply with treatment recommendations and any further treatment that counselor feels is appropriate
Do not possess illegal controlled substances 
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription by a treating physician
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances or drug paraphernalia
Obtain and Maintain full time employment
Comply with other recommendations as recommended by the agent
Submit DNA Sample if not done so already
Pay DNA Surcharge
Pay costs
If agent recommends, can early discharge Defendant from probation
from TBE re: request for furlough denied

8/17/15 $500 cash modified to $500 signature bond with the following conditions: 
Maintain absolute sobriety with regards to alcohol and illegal drugs.
Participate in the Portage County Pre-Trial Supervision Program and comply with the requirements for reporting, assessment, and programming.

State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered.

Atty Drengler makes statements re: modifying bond and believes the State is in agreement with that.  Cash bond is preventing him from taking part in huber/trustee privileges. 
Atty Knaapen makes statements re: condition to be added.

Defendant Edward L. Stoetzel in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. Defendant Edward L. Stoetzel in custody. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions Attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 21, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Do not commit any further crimes. Absolute Sobriety.  Do not possess/consume controlled substances, illegally, without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription.

Defendant Edward L. Stoetzel appeared by video. Prosecuting Atty Cass W Cousins appeared for State of Wisconsin.

9:09 AM Court calls case.
Atty Cousins states appearances.

Defendant appears on video by jail, without counsel.

Court informs Defendant of charges and penalties.
There is an OWI charge and drug panel.

Defendant understands.

Court informs Defendant of preliminary hearing.

Court advises Defendant of right to counsel.

Court questions Defendant.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 17, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
